SEARCH
Package seasofyore

Class BattlePhase

java.lang.Object
seasofyore.AbstractGamePhase
seasofyore.BattlePhase
All Implemented Interfaces:
GamePhase
Direct Known Subclasses:
SalvoBattlePhase
public class BattlePhase extends AbstractGamePhase
Represents the battle phase of the Seas of Yore game. This phase allows players to attack their opponent's quadrant, handles the logic for firing at cells, and determines the outcome of the game (e.g., victory or continuation).

  • Method Details

    • onEnter

      protected void onEnter()
      Initializes the battle phase when it is entered. Disables interaction with the current player's quadrant and enables interaction with the opponent's quadrant.
      Specified by:
      onEnter in class AbstractGamePhase

    • handleCellClick

      public void handleCellClick(int x, int y, QuadrantPanel quadrantPanel)
      Handles a cell click event during the battle phase. Executes the firing logic, manages animations, logs the outcome, and checks for victory.
      Specified by:
      handleCellClick in interface GamePhase
      Overrides:
      handleCellClick in class AbstractGamePhase
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the clicked cell
      y - the y-coordinate of the clicked cell
      quadrantPanel - the QuadrantPanel where the click occurred

    • render

      public void render(Graphics g)
      Renders any visuals specific to the battle phase, such as the falling stone animation.
      Specified by:
      render in interface GamePhase
      Overrides:
      render in class AbstractGamePhase
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object used for rendering

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Cleans up the battle phase when it ends. Removes all components from the drag layer, disables interactions, and repaints the drag layer.

    • getHitIdentifier

      protected String getHitIdentifier(int x, int y)
      Gets a message identifying the result of hitting a cell. Indicates whether a ship was hit or sunk.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the hit cell
      y - the y-coordinate of the hit cell
      Returns:
      a message describing the hit or sunk status of the target
